method.return: The common character style settings

method.name: getCommonContainerFormat
method.description:
Gets the container format attributes that are common to all containers in the element range.

Format attributes that do not have the same value for all containers in the element range are set to null in the returned TextLayoutFormat instance.
method.return: The common paragraph style settings

method.name: getCommonParagraphFormat
method.description:
Gets the paragraph format attributes that are common to all paragraphs in the element range.

Format attributes that do not have the same value for all paragraphs in the element range are set to null in the returned TextLayoutFormat instance.
method.return: The common paragraph style settings

method.name: absoluteEnd
method.description: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

method.name: absoluteStart
method.description: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

method.name: characterFormat
method.description:
The format attributes of the characters in the range.

If the range spans more than one FlowElement object, which means that more than one character format may exist within the range, the format of the first FlowElement object is returned.

method.name: containerFormat
method.description:
The format attributes of the container displaying the range.

If the range spans more than one container, the format of the first container is returned.

method.name: firstLeaf
method.description: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

method.name: firstParagraph
method.description: The ParagraphElement object that contains the start of the range.

method.name: lastLeaf
method.description: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

method.name: lastParagraph
method.description: The ParagraphElement object that contains the end of the range.

method.name: paragraphFormat
method.description:
The format attributes of the paragraph containing the range.

If the range spans more than one paragraph, the format of the first paragraph is returned.

method.name: textFlow
method.description: The TextFlow object that contains the range.

classRec.name: EditingMode
classRec.description:
The EditingMode class defines constants used with EditManager class to represent the
read, select, and edit permissions of a document.

field.name: READ_ONLY
field.description:
The document is read-only.

Neither selection nor editing is allowed.

field.name: READ_SELECT
field.description: The text in the document can be selected and copied, but not edited.

field.name: READ_WRITE
field.description: The document can be edited.

interfaceRec.name: IInteractionEventHandler
interfaceRec.description:
The IInteractionEventHandler interface defines the event handler functions that
are handled by a Text Layout Framework selection or edit manager.

method.name: activateHandler
method.description: Processes an activate event.

method.name: deactivateHandler
method.description: Processes a deactivate event.

method.name: editHandler
method.description:
Processes an edit event.

Edit events are dispatched for cut, copy, paste, and selectAll commands.

method.name: focusChangeHandler
method.description: Processes a focusChange event.

method.name: focusInHandler
method.description: Processes a focusIn event.

method.name: focusOutHandler
method.description: Processes a focusOut event.

method.name: imeStartCompositionHandler
method.description: Processes an imeStartComposition event

method.name: keyDownHandler
method.description: Processes a keyDown event.

method.name: keyFocusChangeHandler
method.description: Processes a keyFocusChange event.

method.name: keyUpHandler
method.description: Processes a keyUp event.

method.name: menuSelectHandler
method.description: Processes a menuSelect event.

method.name: mouseDoubleClickHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseDoubleClick event.

method.name: mouseDownHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseDown event.

method.name: mouseMoveHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseMove event.

method.name: mouseOutHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseOut event.

method.name: mouseOverHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseOver event.

method.name: mouseUpHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseUp event.

method.name: mouseWheelHandler
method.description: Processes a mouseWheel event.

method.name: softKeyboardActivatingHandler
method.description: Processes an softKeyboardActivating event

method.name: textInputHandler
method.description: Processes a TextEvent.

classRec.name: SelectionFormat
classRec.description: The SelectionFormat class defines the properties of a selection highlight.

method.name: SelectionFormat
method.description:
Creates a SelectionFormat object with the specified properties.

A SelectionFormat created with the default values will use black for the highlight colors, 1.0 for the alphas, and BlendMode.DIFFERENCE for the blending modes. The cursor blink rate is 500 milliseconds.

Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

Non-zero blink rate is only used when an EditManager is attached to the TextFlow.
method.param: rangeColor The color for drawing the highlight.

rangeAlpha The transparency value for drawing the highlight. Valid values are between 0
(completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).

rangeBlendMode The blend mode for drawing the highlight. Use constants defined in the BlendMode class
to set this parameter.
pointColor The color for the drawing cursor.

pointAlpha The transparency value for drawing the cursor. Valid values are between 0
(completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).

pointBlendMode The blend mode for drawing the cursor. Use constants defined in the BlendMode class
to set this parameter.
pointBlinkRate The rate at which the cursor blinks, in milliseconds.

method.name: equals
method.description:
Determines whether this SelectionFormat object has the same property values
as another SelectionFormat object.
method.param: selectionFormat the SelectionFormat to compare against.
method.return: true, if the property values are identical; false, otherwise.

method.name: pointAlpha
method.description:
The alpha for drawing the cursor. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).

Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

method.name: pointBlendMode
method.description: The blend mode for drawing the cursor.

method.name: pointBlinkRate
method.description: The rate at which the cursor blinks, in milliseconds.

method.name: pointColor
method.description: The color for drawing the cursor.

method.name: rangeAlpha
method.description:
The alpha for drawing the highlight of a range selection. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).

Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

method.name: rangeBlendMode
method.description: The blending mode for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

method.name: rangeColor
method.description: The color for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

classRec.name: TextClipboard
classRec.description:
The TextClipboard class copies and pastes TextScrap objects to and from the system clipboard.

When you copy a TextScrap to the TextClipboard, the information is copied to the system clipboard in two clipboard formats. One format is an XML string expressing the copied TextScrap object in Text Layout Markup syntax. This clipboard object uses the format name: "TEXT_LAYOUT_MARKUP". The second format is a plain-text string, which uses the standard Clipboard.TEXT_FORMAT name.

The methods of the TextClipboard class are static functions, you do not need to create an instance of TextClipboard.

method.name: getContents
method.description:
Gets any text on the system clipboard as a TextScrap object.

If the "TEXT_LAYOUT_MARKUP" format is available, this method converts the formatted string into a TextScrap and returns it. Otherwise, if the Clipboard.TEXT_Format is available, this method converts the plain-text string into a TextScrap. If neither clipboard format is available, this method returns null.

Flash Player requires that the getContents() method be called in a paste event handler. In AIR, this restriction only applies to content outside of the application security sandbox.

method.name: setContents
method.description:
Puts a TextScrap onto the system clipboard.

The TextScrap is placed onto the system clipboard as both a Text Layout Markup representation and a plain text representation.

Flash Player requires a user event (such as a key press or mouse click) before calling setContents(). In AIR, this restriction only applies to content outside of the application security sandbox.
method.param: scrap The TextScrap to paste into the clipboard.

method.name: getTextInRange
method.description: Gets the specified range of text from a component implementing ITextSupport. To retrieve all text in the component, do not specify values for startIndex and endIndex. Components which wish to support inline IME or web searchability should call into this method. Components overriding this method should ensure that the default values of -1 for startIndex and endIndex are supported.

field.name: _imeAnchorPosition
field.description: Maintain position of text we've inserted while in the middle of processing IME.

classRec.name: SelectionState
classRec.description:
The SelectionState class represents a selection in a text flow.

A selection range has an anchor point, representing the point at which the selection of text began, and an active point, representing the point to which the selection is extended. The active point can be before or after the anchor point in the text. If a selection is modified (for example, by a user shift-clicking with the mouse), the active point changes while the anchor point always remains in the same position.

method.name: SelectionState
method.description:
Creates a SelectionState object.

Note: Do not construct a SelectionState object in order to create a selection. To create a selection in a text flow, call the setSelection() method of the relevant ISelectionManager instance (which is the SelectionManager or EditManager object assigned to the interactionManager property of the text flow).
method.param: root The TextFlow associated with the selection.
anchorPosition The anchor index of the selection.
activePosition The active index of the selection.
format The TextLayoutFormat to be applied on next character typed when a point selection

method.name: updateRange
method.description:
Updates the selection range with new anchor or active position values.

The pointFormat styles are cleared if the selection is changed.
method.param: newAnchorPosition the anchor index of the selection.
newActivePosition the active index of the selection.
method.return: true if selection is changed

method.name: pointFormat
method.description:
The format attributes applied to inserted text.

Note: The pointFormat object does not include inherited styles. To get all the applicable style definitions, use the getCommonCharacterFormat() method of the ISelectionManager class.

field.name: _pointFormat
field.description: Format that are associated with the caret position & will be applied to inserted text

interfaceRec.name: ISelectionManager
interfaceRec.description:
The ISelectionManager interface defines the interface for handling text selection.

A SelectionManager keeps track of the selected text range and handles events for a TextFlow.

A selection can be either a point selection or a range selection. A point selection is the insertion point and is indicated visually by drawing a cursor. A range selection includes the text between an anchor point and an active point.

method.name: flushPendingOperations
method.description:
Executes any pending FlowOperations.

The execution of some editing operations, such as text insertion, is delayed until the next enterFrame event. Calling flushPendingOperations() causes any deferred operations to be executed immediately.

method.name: getCommonCharacterFormat
method.description:
Gets the character format attributes that are common to all characters in the specified text range or current selection.

Format attributes that do not have the same value for all characters in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned TextLayoutFormat instance.
method.param: range The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
method.return: The common character style settings

method.name: getCommonContainerFormat
method.description:
Gets the container format attributes that are common to all containers in the specified text range or current selection.

Format attributes that do not have the same value for all containers in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned TextLayoutFormat instance.
method.param: range The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
method.return: The common container style settings

method.name: getCommonParagraphFormat
method.description:
Gets the paragraph format attributes that are common to all paragraphs in the specified text range or current selection.

Format attributes that do not have the same value for all paragraphs in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned TextLayoutFormat instance.
method.param: range The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
method.return: The common paragraph style settings

method.name: getSelectionState
method.description: Gets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

method.name: hasSelection
method.description:
Indicates whether there is a selection.

Returns true if there is either a range selection or a point selection. By default, when a selection manager is first set up, there is no selection (the start and end are -1).

method.name: isRangeSelection
method.description:
Indicates whether the selection covers a range of text.

Returns true if there is a selection that extends past a single position.

method.name: notifyInsertOrDelete
method.description:
Updates the selection manager when text is inserted or deleted.

Operations must call notifyInsertOrDelete when changing the text in the text flow. The selection manager adjusts index-based position indicators accordingly. If you create a new Operation class that changes text in a text flow directly (not using another operation) your operation must call this function to keep the selection up to date.
method.param: absolutePosition The point in the text where the change was made.
length A positive or negative number indicating how many characters were inserted or deleted.

method.name: refreshSelection
method.description:
Redisplays the selection shapes.

Note: You do not need to call this method directly. It is called automatically.

method.name: selectAll
method.description: Selects the entire flow.

method.name: selectRange
method.description:
Selects a range of text.

If a negative number is passed as either of the parameters, then any existing selection is removed.
method.param: anchorPosition The anchor point for the new selection, as an absolute position in the TextFlow
activePosition The active end of the new selection, as an absolute position in the TextFlow

method.name: setFocus
method.description: Gives the focus to the first container in the selection.

method.name: setSelectionState
method.description: Sets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

method.name: absoluteEnd
method.description:
The text position of the end of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.

The absolute end is the same as either the active or the anchor point of the selection, whichever comes last in the text flow.

method.name: absoluteStart
method.description:
The text position of the start of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.

The absolute start is the same as either the active or the anchor point of the selection, whichever comes first in the text flow.

method.name: activePosition
method.description:
The active point of the selection.

The active point is the volatile end of the selection. The active point is changed when the selection is modified. The active point can be at either the beginning or the end of the selection.

method.name: anchorPosition
method.description:
The anchor point of the selection.

An anchor point is the stable end of the selection. When the selection is extended, the anchor point does not change. The anchor point can be at either the beginning or the end of the selection.

method.name: currentSelectionFormat
method.description:
The current SelectionFormat object.

The current SelectionFormat object is chosen from the SelectionFormat objects assigned to the unfocusedSelectionFormat, inactiveSelectionFormat and focusedSelectionFormat properties based on the current state of the windowActive and focused properties.

method.name: editingMode
method.description:
The editing mode.

The editing mode indicates whether the text flow supports selection, editing, or only reading. A text flow is made selectable by assigning a selection manager and editable by assigning an edit manager. Constants representing the editing modes are defined in the EditingMode class.

method.name: focusedSelectionFormat
method.description: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection in a focused container.

method.name: focused
method.description:
Indicates whether a container in the text flow has the focus.

The focused property is true if any of the containers in the text flow has key focus.

method.name: inactiveSelectionFormat
method.description: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in the active window.

method.name: textFlow
method.description:
The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.

A selection manager manages a single text flow. A selection manager can also be assigned to a text flow by setting the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object.

method.name: unfocusedSelectionFormat
method.description:
The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in a focused container, but is in
the active window.

method.name: windowActive
method.description:
Indicates whether the window associated with the text flow is active.

The windowActive property is true if the window displaying with the text flow is the active window.

classRec.name: SelectionManager
classRec.description:
The SelectionManager class manages text selection in a text flow.

The selection manager keeps track of the selected text range, manages its formatting, and can handle events affecting the selection. To allow a user to make selections in a text flow, assign a SelectionManager object to the interactionManager property of the flow. (To allow editing, assign an instance of the EditManager class, which extends SelectionManager.)

The following table describes how the SelectionManager class handles keyboard shortcuts:

TB,LTRTB,RTLTL,LTRRL,RTL
nonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+alt
leftarrowpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordnextCharacternextWordnextWordnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraph
uparrowpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordnextCharacternextWordnextWord
rightarrownextCharacternextWordnextWordpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraph
downarrownextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextCharacternextWordnextWordpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWord
homestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLine
endendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLine
pagedownnextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPage
pageuppreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPage

Key:

  • none = no modifier
  • ctrl, shift, alt = modifiers
  • alt-key and ctrl+alt-key are the same on all platforms (on some platforms alt-key does not get to the Text Layout Framework (TLF)
  • shift key modifes to extend the active end of the selection in the specified manner
  • TB (top-to-bottom),RL (right-to-left) are textFlow level blockProgression settings
  • LTR (left-to-right),RTL (right-to-left) are textFlow level direction settings
  • next and prev in logical order in the textFlow - the effect in RTL text is that the selection moves in the physical direction

method.name: SelectionManager
method.description:
Creates a SelectionManager object.

Assign a SelectionManager object to the interactionManager property of a text flow to enable text selection.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear any active selections.

method.name: doOperation
method.description: Perform a SelectionManager operation - these may never modify the flow but clients still are able to cancel them.

method.name: keyFocusChangeHandler
method.param: event the FocusChange event

method.name: keyUpHandler
method.param: event the keyUp event

method.name: selectionChanged
method.param: doDispatchEvent true if a selection changed event will be sent
resetPointFormat true if the attributes associated with the caret should be discarded

method.name: selectionPoint
method.description: Gets the SelectionState at the specified mouse position.
method.param: currentTarget The object that is actively processing the Event object with an event listener.

target The InteractiveObject instance under the pointing device. The target is not always the object in the display list that registered the event listener. Use the currentTarget property to access the object in the display list that is currently processing the event.
localX The horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the containing sprite.
localY The vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the containing sprite.
extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: the resulting SelectionState

method.name: setMouseCursor
method.description: Set the Mouse cursor.
method.param: cursor New cursor value, MouseCursor.AUTO if mouse is going off text, MouseCursor.IBEAM if mouse is going into text

method.name: setNewSelectionPoint
method.description: initialize a new point selection at click point

method.name: updateSelectionAndShapes
method.description: Refreshes and displays TextFlow selection defined by a beginning and ending index.

method.name: pointFormat
method.description:
The format that will be applied to inserted text.
TBD: pointFormat needs to be extended to remember user styles and "undefine" of formats from calls to IEditManager.undefineFormat with leafFormat values on a point selection.

method.name: textFlow
method.description:
The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.

A selection manager manages a single text flow. A selection manager can also be assigned to a text flow by setting the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object.

field.name: _textFlow
field.description: The TextFlow of the selection.

field.name: activeMark
field.description: Active end of the current selection, as an index into the TextFlow.

field.name: anchorMark
field.description: Anchor point of the current selection, as an index into the TextFlow.

interfaceRec.name: IEditManager
interfaceRec.description:
IEditManager defines the interface for handling edit operations of a text flow.

To enable text flow editing, assign an IEditManager instance to the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object. The edit manager handles changes to the text (such as insertions, deletions, and format changes). Changes are reversible if the edit manager has an undo manager. The edit manager triggers the recomposition and display of the text flow, as necessary.

method.name: applyContainerFormat
method.description:
Applies container styles to any containers in the selection.

Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged.
method.param: format The format to apply to the containers in the range
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: applyFormatToElement
method.description:
Applies styles to the specified element.

Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged. Only styles that are relevant to the specified element are applied.
method.param: targetElement The element to which the styles are applied.
format The format containing the styles to apply.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new formatting.
relativeEnd An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when applying the new formatting.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: applyFormat
method.description:
Changes the formats of the specified (or current) selection.

Executes an undoable operation that applies the new formats. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format objects are not changed.
method.param: leafFormat The format to apply to leaf elements such as spans and inline graphics.
paragraphFormat The format to apply to paragraph elements.
containerFormat The format to apply to the containers.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: applyLeafFormat
method.description:
Changes the format applied to the leaf elements in the specified (or current) selection.

Executes an undoable operation that applies the new format to leaf elements such as SpanElement and InlineGraphicElement objects. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format object are changed.
method.param: format The format to apply.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: applyLink
method.description:
Transforms a selection into a link, or a link into normal text.

Executes an undoable operation that creates or removes the link.

If a target parameter is specified, it must be one of the following values:

  • "_self"
  • "_blank"
  • "_parent"
  • "_top"

In browser-hosted runtimes, a target of "_self" replaces the current html page. So, if the SWF content containing the link is in a page within a frame or frameset, the linked content loads within that frame. If the page is at the top level, the linked content opens to replace the original page. A target of "_blank" opens a new browser window with no name. A target of "_parent" replaces the parent of the html page containing the SWF content. A target of "_top" replaces the top-level page in the current browser window.

In other runtimes, such as Adobe AIR, the link opens in the user's default browser and the target parameter is ignored.

The extendToLinkBoundary parameter determines how the edit manager treats a selection that intersects with one or more existing links. If the parameter is true, then the operation is applied as a unit to the selection and the whole text of the existing links. Thus, a single link is created that spans from the beginning of the first link intersected to the end of the last link intersected. In contrast, if extendToLinkBoundary were false in this situation, the existing partially selected links would be split into two links.
method.param: href The uri referenced by the link.
target The target browser window of the link.
extendToLinkBoundary Specifies whether to consolidate selection with any overlapping existing links, and then apply the change.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The LinkElement that was created.

method.name: applyParagraphFormat
method.description:
Applies paragraph styles to any paragraphs in the selection.

Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged.
method.param: format The format to apply to the selected paragraphs.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: applyTCY
method.description:
Transforms text into a TCY run, or a TCY run into non-TCY text.

TCY, or tate-chu-yoko, causes text to draw horizontally within a vertical line, and is used to make small blocks of non-Japanese text or numbers, such as dates, more readable in vertical text.
method.param: tcyOn Set to true to apply TCY to a text range, false to remove TCY.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The TCYElement that was created.

method.name: beginCompositeOperation
method.description:
Begins a new group of operations.

All operations executed after the call to beginCompositeOperation(), and before the matching call to endCompositeOperation() are executed and grouped together as a single operation that can be undone as a unit.

A beginCompositeOperation/endCompositeOperation block can be nested inside another beginCompositeOperation/endCompositeOperation block.

method.name: changeElementID
method.description:
Changes the ID of an element.

If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set (to anything other than the default values), then the element is split. The parts of the element outside this range retain the original ID. Setting both the relativeStart and relativeEnd parameters creates elements with duplicate IDs.
method.param: newID The new ID value.
targetElement The element to modify.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new ID.
relativeEnd An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new ID.
operationState Specifies the selection to restore when undoing this operation; if null, the operation saves the current selection.

method.name: changeStyleName
method.description:
Changes the styleName of an element or part of an element.

If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set (to anything other than the default values), then the element is split. The parts of the element outside this range retain the original style.
method.param: newName The name of the new style.
targetElement Specifies the element to change.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style.
operationState Specifies the selection to restore when undoing this operation; if null, the operation saves the current selection.

method.name: changeTypeName
method.description:
Changes the typeName of an element or part of an element.

If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set (to anything other than the default values), then the element is split. The parts of the element outside this range retain the original style.
method.param: newName The name of the new type.
targetElement Specifies the element to change.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style
operationState Specifies the selection to restore when undoing this operation; if null, the operation saves the current selection.

method.name: clearFormatOnElement
method.description:
Undefines styles to the specified element.

Any style properties in the format object that are undefined are left unchanged. Any styles that are defined in the specififed format are undefined on the specified element.
method.param: targetElement The element to which the styles are applied.
format The format containing the styles to undefine.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: clearFormat
method.description:
Undefines formats of the specified (or current) selection.

Executes an undoable operation that undefines the specified formats. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format objects are not changed.
method.param: leafFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to LeafFlowElement objects in the selected range.
paragraphFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ParagraphElement objects in the selected range.
containerFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ContainerController objects in the selected range.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: createDiv
method.description:
Creates a new DivElement that contains the entire range specified in the operationState at the lowest
common parent element that contains both the start and end points of the range. If the start and end
points are the same, a new DivElement is created at that position with a single child paragraph.
method.param: parent Specifies a parent element for the new DivElement. If null the new parent will be lowest level that contains the SelectionState.
format Formatting attributes to apply to the new DivElement.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The new DivElement that was created.

method.name: createList
method.description:
Creates a new ListElement that contains the entire range specified in the operationState at the lowest
common parent element that contains both the start and end points of the range. Each paragraph within the
range will become a ListItemElement in the new ListElement. If the start and end
points are the same, a new ListElement is created at that position with a single ListItemElement child.
method.param: parent Optionally specifies a parent element for the new ListElement. If null the new parent will be lowest level that contains the SelectionState.
format Formatting attributes to apply to the new ListElement.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The new ListElement that was created.

method.name: createSubParagraphGroup
method.description:
Creates a new SubParagraphGroupElement that contains the entire range specified in the operationState at the lowest
common parent element that contains both the start and end points of the range. If the start and end
points are the same, nothing is done.
method.param: parent Specifies a parent element for the new SubParagraphGroupElement element. If null the new parent will be lowest level that contains the SelectionState.
format Formatting attributes to apply to the new SubParagraphGroupElement
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The new SubParagraphGroupElement that was created.

method.name: cutTextScrap
method.description:
Deletes the selected area and returns the deleted area in a TextScrap object.

The resulting TextScrap can be posted to the system clipboard or used in a subsequent pasteTextOperation() operation.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The TextScrap that was cut.

method.name: deleteNextCharacter
method.description: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the next character.
method.param: operationState specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: deleteNextWord
method.description:
Deletes the next word.

If a range is selected, the first word of the range is deleted.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: deletePreviousCharacter
method.description: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the previous character.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: deletePreviousWord
method.description:
Deletes the previous word.

If a range is selected, the first word of the range is deleted.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: deleteText
method.description: Deletes a range of text.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: doOperation
method.description:
Executes a FlowOperation.

The doOperation() method is called by IEditManager functions that update the text flow. You do not typically need to call this function directly unless you create your own custom operations.

This function proceeds in the following steps:

  1. Flush any pending operations before performing this operation.
  2. Send a cancelable flowOperationBegin event. If canceled this method returns immediately.
  3. Execute the operation. The operation returns true or false. False indicates that no changes were made.
  4. Push the operation onto the undo stack.
  5. Clear the redo stack.
  6. Update the display.
  7. Send a cancelable flowOperationEnd event.

Exception handling: If the operation throws an exception, it is caught and the error is attached to the flowOperationEnd event. If the event is not canceled the error is rethrown.
method.param: operation a FlowOperation object

method.name: endCompositeOperation
method.description:
Ends a group of operations.

All operations executed since the last call to beginCompositeOperation() are grouped as a CompositeOperation that is then completed. This CompositeOperation object is added to the undo stack or, if this composite operation is nested inside another composite operation, added to the parent operation.

method.name: insertInlineGraphic
method.description:
Inserts an image.

The source of the image can be a string containing a URI, URLRequest object, a Class object representing an embedded asset, or a DisplayObject instance.

The width and height values can be the number of pixels, a percent, or the string, 'auto', in which case the actual dimension of the graphic is used.

Set the float to one of the constants defined in the Float class to specify whether the image should be displayed to the left or right of any text or inline with the text.
method.param:
source Can be either a String interpreted as a uri, a Class interpreted as the class of an Embed DisplayObject,
a DisplayObject instance or a URLRequest.
width The width of the image to insert (number, percent, or 'auto').
height The height of the image to insert (number, percent, or 'auto').
options None supported.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: insertText
method.description:
Inserts text.

Inserts the text at a position or range in the text. If the location supplied in the operationState parameter is a range (or the parameter is null and the current selection is a range), then the text currently in the range is replaced by the inserted text.
method.param: text The string to insert.
operationState Specifies the text in the flow to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: modifyInlineGraphic
method.description:
Modifies an existing inline graphic.

Set unchanging properties to the values in the original graphic. (Modifying an existing graphic object is typically more efficient than deleting and recreating one.)
method.param:
source Can be either a String interpreted as a uri, a Class interpreted as the class of an Embed DisplayObject,
a DisplayObject instance or a URLRequest.
width The new width for the image (number or percent).
height The new height for the image (number or percent).
options None supported.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: moveChildren
method.description:
Move a set of FlowElements from one FlowGroupElement to another. The desinationElement must be a legal parent type for the children being moved,
or an exception is thrown.
method.param: source The orginal parent of the elements to be moved.
sourceIndex The child index within the source of the first element to be moved.
numChildren The number of children being moved.
destination The new parent of elements after move.
destinationIndex The child index within the destination to where elements are moved to.

operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies, and to which selection returns to upon undo. If null, the operation applies to the current selection. If there is no current selection, this parameter must be non-null.

method.name: overwriteText
method.description:
Overwrites the selected text.

If the selection is a point selection, the first character is overwritten by the new text.
method.param: text The string to insert.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: pasteTextScrap
method.description:
Pastes the TextScrap into the selected area.

If a range of text is specified, the text in the range is deleted.
method.param: scrapToPaste The TextScrap to paste.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

method.name: redo
method.description:
Reperforms the previous undone operation.

Note: If the IUndoManager associated with this IEditManager is also associated with another IEditManager, then it is possible that the redo operation associated with the other IEditManager is the one redone. This can happen if the FlowOperation of another IEditManager is on top of the redo stack.

This function does nothing if undo is not turned on.

method.name: splitElement
method.description:
Splits the target element at the location specified, creating a new element after the current one. If the operationState is a range, the text within the range is deleted. The new element is created after the text position specified by operationState. Note that splitting a SubParagraphGroupElement will have no effect because they will automatically remerge with the adejacent elements.

An example where you might want to use this is if you have a list, and you want to divide it into two lists.
method.param: target The element to be split.
operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The new paragraph that was created.

method.name: splitParagraph
method.description:
Splits the paragraph at the current position, creating a new paragraph after the current one.

If a range of text is specified, the text in the range is deleted.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.
method.return: The new paragraph that was created.

method.name: undo
method.description:
Reverses the previous operation.

Note: If the IUndoManager associated with this IEditManager is also associated with another IEditManager, then it is possible that the undo operation associated with the other IEditManager is the one undone. This can happen if the FlowOperation of another IEditManager is on top of the undo stack.

This function does nothing if undo is not turned on.

method.name: updateAllControllers
method.description: Updates the display after an operation has modified it. Normally this is handled automatically, but call this method if delayUpdates is on, and the display should be updated before the next enter_frame event.

method.name: allowDelayedOperations
method.description:
Controls whether operations can be queued up for later execution.

Execution of some operations might be delayed as a performance optimization. For example, it is convenient to be able to combine multiple keystrokes into a single insert operation. If allowDelayedOperations is true, then operations may be queued up. If false, all operations are executed immediately. By default, it is true.

method.name: delayUpdates
method.description: By default, calls into IEditManager handle updates synchronously, so the requested change is made and the text recomposed and added to the display list within the IEditManager method. To get a delayed redraw, set delayUpdates to true. This causes the IEditManager to only update the model, and recompose and redraw on the next enter_frame event.

method.name: undoManager
method.description:
The UndoManager object assigned to this EditManager instance, if there is one.

An undo manager handles undo and redo operations.

classRec.name: EditManager
classRec.description:
The EditManager class manages editing changes to a TextFlow.

To enable text flow editing, assign an EditManager object to the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object. The edit manager handles changes to the text (such as insertions, deletions, and format changes). Changes are reversible if the edit manager has an undo manager. The edit manager triggers the recomposition and display of the text flow, as necessary.

The EditManager class supports the following keyboard shortcuts:

KeysResult
ctrl-zundo
ctrl-yredo
ctrl-backspacedeletePreviousWord
ctrl-deletedeleteNextWord
alt+deletedeleteNextWord
ctrl+alt-deletedeleteNextWord
ctrl-shift-hypheninsert discretionary hyphen
ctrl+backspacedeletePreviousWord
alt+backspacedeletePreviousWord
ctrl+alt-backspacedeletePreviousWord
INSERTtoggles overWriteMode
backspacedeletePreviousCharacter
ENTERif textFlow.configuration.manageEnterKey in a list it creates a new list item, otherwise creates a new paragraph
shift-ENTERif textFlow.configuration.manageEnterKey creates a new paragraph
TABif textFlow.configuration.manageTabKey in a list it creates nested list, otherwise inserts a TAB or overwrites next character with a TAB
shift-TABif textFlow.configuration.manageTabKey in the first item of a list it moves the item out of the list (promotes it)

Note: The following keys do not work on Windows: alt-backspace, alt-delete, ctrl+alt-backspace, and ctrl+alt-delete. These keys do not generate an event for the runtime.

method.name: EditManager
method.description:
Creates an EditManager object.

Assign an EditManager object to the interactionManager property of a text flow to enable editing of that text flow.

To enable support for undoing and redoing changes, pass an IUndoManager instance to the EditManager constructor. You can use the flashx.undo.UndoManager class or create a custom IUndoManager instance. Use a custom IUndoManager instance to integrate Text Layout Framework changes with an existing undo manager that is not an instance of the UndoManager class. To create a custom IUndoManager instance, ensure that the class you use to define the undo manager implements the IUndoManager interface.
method.param: undo The UndoManager for the application

method.name: applyLink
method.copy:
IEditManager#applyLink()
Returns the new LinkElement that was created.

method.name: applyTCY
method.copy:
IEditManager#applyTCY()
Returns the new TCYElement that was created.

method.name: clearFormat
method.copy:
IEditManager#clearFormat()
Known issue is that undefines of leafFormat values with a point selection are not applied at the next insertion.

method.name: doInternal
method.description:
Internal guts of a dooperation - Execute a FlowOperation. This function proceeds in steps.

Step 2. Send a canceallable OperationEvent. If cancelled this method returns immediately.

If it is not cancelled, the listener may "do" other operations by calling back into the EditManager. This will result in a nested call to do which will post additional commands to the captureOperations array.

Step 3. Execute the operation. The operation returns true or false. false indicates no changes were made.

Step 7. Send a OperationEvent.

The listener may "do" other operations by calling back into the EditManager. This will result in a nested call to do which will post additional commands to the captureOperations array.

Exception handling. If the operation throws the exception is caught and the error is attached to the event dispatched at step 7. If the event is not cancelled the error is rethrown.

method.name: insertInlineGraphic
method.copy:
IEditManager#insertInlineGraphic()
Returns the new InlineGraphicElement that was created.

method.name: selectionChanged
method.param: doDispatchEvent true if a selection changed event will be sent
resetPointFormat true if the attributes associated with the caret should be discarded

method.name: undoManager
method.description:
The IUndoManager assigned to this edit manager.

To allow edits to be undone (and redone), pass an IUndoManager instance to the EditManager constructor. The undo manager maintains a stack of operations that have been executed, and it can undo or redo individual operations.

Note: If the TextFlow is modified directly (not via calls to the EditManager, but directly via calls to the managed FlowElement objects), then the EditManager clears the undo stack to prevent the stack from getting out of sync with the current state.

field.name: overwriteMode
field.description:
Indicates whether overwrite mode is on or off.

If true, then a keystroke overwrites the character following the cursor. If false, then a keystroke is inserted at the cursor location.

field.name: pendingInsert
field.description:
To minimize expensive recompositions during fast typing, inserts
don't necessarily take place immediately. An insert operation that
hasn't yet executed is held here.

interfaceRec.name: IOperation
interfaceRec.description: IOperation defines the interface for operations that can be undone and redone.

method.name: performRedo
method.description:
Reperforms the operation.

The operation is also responsible for pushing itself onto the undo stack.

method.name: performUndo
method.description:
Reverses the operation.

The operation is also responsible for pushing itself onto the redo stack.

interfaceRec.name: IUndoManager
interfaceRec.description:
IUndoManager defines the interface for managing the undo and redo stacks.

An undo manager maintains a stack of operations that can be undone and redone.

method.name: canRedo
method.description: Indicates whether there is currently an operation that can be redone.
method.return: Boolean true, if there is an operation on the redo stack that can be redone. Otherwise, false.

method.name: canUndo
method.description: Indicates whether there is currently an operation that can be undone.
method.return: Boolean true, if there is an operation on the undo stack that can be reversed. Otherwise, false.

method.name: clearAll
method.description: Clears both the undo and the redo histories.

method.name: clearRedo
method.description: Clears the redo stack.

method.name: peekRedo
method.description: Returns the next operation to be redone.
method.return: The redoable IOperation object, or null, if no redoable operation is on the stack.

method.name: peekUndo
method.description: Returns the next operation to be undone.
method.return: The undoable IOperation object, or null, if no undoable operation is on the stack.

method.name: popRedo
method.description: Removes the next operation to be redone from the redo stack, and returns it.
method.return: The redoable IOperation object, or null, if no redoable operation is on the stack.

method.name: popUndo
method.description: Removes the next operation to be undone from the undo stack, and returns it.
method.return: The undoable IOperation object, or null, if no undoable operation is on the stack.

method.name: pushRedo
method.description: Adds a redoable operation to the redo stack.

method.name: pushUndo
method.description: Adds an undoable operation to the undo stack.

method.name: redo
method.description:
Removes the next IOperation object from the redo stack and calls the performRedo()
function of that object.

method.name: undo
method.description:
Removes the next IOperation object from the undo stack and calls the performUndo()
function of that object.

method.name: undoAndRedoItemLimit
method.description:
The maximum number of undoable or redoable operations to track.

To disable the undo function, set this value to 0.

classRec.name: UndoManager
classRec.description:
The UndoManager class manages the history of editing operations on a text flow so that these operations can be undone and redone.

The undo manager maintains two stacks of IOperation objects. When a reversible operation is executed, it is placed on the undo stack. If that operation is undone, it is removed from the undo stack, reversed, and placed on the redo stack. Likewise, if that operation is then redone, it is removed from the redo stack, re-executed, and then placed onto the undo stack again. If another operation is executed first, the redo stack is cleared.

If the TextFlow is modified directly (not via calls to the edit manager, but directly via calls to the managed FlowElement objects), then the edit manager clears the undo stack to prevent the stack from getting out of sync with the current state.

method.name: UndoManager
method.description: Creates an UndoManager object.

method.name: trimUndoRedoStacks
method.description: trim the sizes of the undo/redo stacks to the maximum limits

method.name: undoAndRedoItemLimit
method.tiptext: The maximum number of undoable or redoable operations to track.

classRec.name: NavigationUtil
classRec.description: Utilities for manipulating a TextRange The methods of this class are static and must be called using the syntax NavigationUtil.method(parameter).

method.name: adjustForOversetBack
method.description: If the range is in overset text (after the last container in a non-scrolling flow), adjust the range so it is at the end of the last controller in the flow.

method.name: adjustForOversetForward
method.description: If the range is in overset text (after the last container in a non-scrolling flow), adjust the range so it is at the end of the flow.

method.name: endOfDocument
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the end of the document.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: endOfLine
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the end of the line.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: endOfParagraph
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the end of the paragraph.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: nextAtomPosition
method.description: Returns the absolute position of the next atom.

method.name: nextCharacter
method.description: Sets the TextRange forward by one character.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: nextLine
method.description: Sets the TextRange down one line
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: nextPage
method.description: Sets the TextRange down one page.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: nextWordPosition
method.description: Returns the absolute position of the beginning of the next word.

method.name: nextWord
method.description: Sets the TextRange forward by one word.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: previousAtomPosition
method.description: Returns the absolute position of the previous atom.

method.name: previousCharacter
method.description: Sets the TextRange backward by one character.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: previousLine
method.description: Sets the TextRange up one line.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: previousPage
method.description: Sets the TextRange up one page.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: previousWordPosition
method.description: Returns absolute position of the beginning of the previous word.

method.name: previousWord
method.description: Sets the TextRange backward by one word.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: startOfDocument
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the beginning of the document.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: startOfLine
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the beginning of the line.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

method.name: startOfParagraph
method.description: Sets the TextRange at the beginning of the paragraph.
method.param: extendSelection Indicates that only activeIndex should move
method.return: true if selection changed.

classRec.name: CharacterUtil
classRec.description: Utilities for managing and getting information about characters. The methods of this class are static and must be called using the syntax CharacterUtil.method(parameter).

method.name: isHighSurrogate
method.description:
Returns true if the charCode argument is a high word in a surrogate pair. A surrogate pair represents a character with a code point that requires more than sixteen bits to express and thus requires a combination of two 16-bit words, a high surrogate and a low surrogate, to embody its code point.

This method can be used when processing a series of characters to ensure that you do not inadvertently divide a surrogate pair into incomplete halves.
method.param: charCode An integer that represents a character code. Character codes are usually represented in hexadecimal format. For example, the space character's character code can be represented by the number 0x0020.
method.return: true if charCode is the high surrogate in a surrogate pair.

method.name: isLowSurrogate
method.description:
Returns true if the charCode argument is a low word in a surrogate pair. A surrogate pair represents a character with a code point that requires more than sixteen bits to express and thus requires a combination of two 16-bit words, a high surrogate and a low surrogate, to embody its code point.

This method can be used when processing a series of characters to ensure that you do not inadvertently divide a surrogate pair into incomplete halves.
method.param: charCode An integer that represents a character code. Character codes are usually represented in hexadecimal format. For example, the space character's character code can be represented by the number 0x0020.
method.return: true if charCode is the low surrogate in a surrogate pair.

method.name: isWhitespace
method.description:
Returns true if charCode is a whitespace character.

The following table describes all characters that this method considers a whitespace character.

Character CodeUnicode Character NameCategory
0x0020SPACESpace Separator
0x1680OGHAM SPACE MARKSpace Separator
0x180EMONGOLIAN VOWEL SEPARATORSpace Separator
0x2000EN QUADSpace Separator
0x2001EM QUADSpace Separator
0x2002EN SPACESpace Separator
0x2003EM SPACESpace Separator
0x2004THREE-PER-EM SPACESpace Separator
0x2005FOUR-PER-EM SPACESpace Separator
0x2006SIX-PER-EM SPACESpace Separator
0x2007FIGURE SPACESpace Separator
0x2008PUNCTUATION SPACESpace Separator
0x2009THIN SPACESpace Separator
0x200AHAIR SPACESpace Separator
0x202FNARROW NO-BREAK SPACESpace Separator
0x205FMEDIUM MATHEMATICAL SPACESpace Separator
0x3000IDEOGRAPHIC SPACESpace Separator
0x2028LINE SEPARATORLine Separator
0x2029PARAGRAPH SEPARATORParagraph Separator
0x0009CHARACTER TABULATIONOther
0x000ALINE FEEDOther
0x000BLINE TABULATIONOther
0x000CFORM FEEDOther
0x000DCARRIAGE RETURNOther
0x0085NEXT LINEOther
0x00A0NO-BREAK SPACEOther
method.param: charCode An integer that represents a character code. Character codes are usually represented in hexadecimal format. For example, the space character's character code can be represented by the number 0x0020.
method.return: true if charCode is a whitespace character.

classRec.name: CompositionAttributeRange
classRec.description:
The CompositionAttributeRange class represents a range of composition attributes for use with IME events. For example, when editing text in the IME, the text is divided by the IME into composition ranges. These composition ranges are flagged as selected (i.e. currently being lengthened, shortened, or edited), and/or converted (i.e. they have made one pass through the IME dictionary lookup already).

By convention, the client should adorn these composition ranges with underlining or hiliting according to the flags.

For example:

!converted = thick gray underline (raw text) !selected && converted = thin black underline selected && converted = thick black underline

method.name: CompositionAttributeRange
method.description: Creates a CompositionAttributeRange object.
method.param: relativeStart The zero based index of the first character included in the character range.
relativeEnd The zero based index of the last character included in the character range.
selected The selected flag
converted The converted flag

field.name: converted
field.description:
The converted flag, meaning this clause has been processed by the IME
and is awaiting acceptance/confirmation by the user

field.name: relativeEnd
field.description:
The relative end of the composition clause, relative to the beginning
of the inline edit session.
i.e. 0 = the start of the text the IME can see (there may be text
before that in the edit field)

field.name: relativeStart
field.description:
The relative start from the beginning of the inline edit session
i.e. 0 = the start of the text the IME can see (there may be text
before that in the edit field)

field.name: selected
field.description:
The selected flag, meaning this composition clause is active and
being lengthened or shortened or edited with the IME, and the neighboring
clauses are not.

interfaceRec.name: IIMEClient
interfaceRec.description:
Interface for IME (input method editor) clients. Components based on the flash.text.engine package must implement this interface to support editing text inline using an IME. This interface is not used with TextField objects. TextLayoutFramework (TLF) uses this interface to support inline IME, so clients using TLF do not need to implement this interface.

To support inline IME, set the imeClient property of an ImeEvent.IME_START_COMPOSITION event to an object which implements this interface.

Event.name: textInput
Event.description: Dispatched when the user enters text. For IME (input method editor) clients, the receiver should insert the string contained in the event object's text property at the current insertion point.

Event.name: imeStartComposition
Event.description: Dispatched when the user begins to use an IME (input method editor).

method.name: confirmComposition
method.description: Use this callback to end the inline editing session and confirm the text.
method.param: text the final state of the text in the inline session (the text that got confirmed).
preserveSelection when true, you should not reset the current selection to the end of the confirmed text.

method.name: getTextBounds
method.description:
This callback is used by the IME to query the bounding box of the text being edited with the IME client.
Use this method to place the candidate window and set the mouse cursor in the IME client when the mouse is over the
text field or other component that supports IME.
method.param: startIndex an integer that specifies the starting location of the range of text for which you need to measure the bounding box.
endIndex Optional; an integer that specifies the ending location of the range of text for which you need to measure the bounding box.
method.return: the bounding box of the specified range of text, or null if either or both of the indexes are invalid. The same value should be returned independant of whether startIndex is greater or less than endIndex.

method.name: getTextInRange
method.description: Gets the specified range of text from the component. This method is called during IME reconversion.
method.param: startIndex an integer that specifies the starting location of the range of text to be retrieved.
endIndex an integer that specifies the ending location of the range of text to be retrieved.
method.return: The requested text, or null if no text is available in the requested range or if either or both of the indexes are invalid. The same value should be returned independant of whether startIndex is greater or less than endIndex.

method.name: selectRange
method.description:
Sets the range of selected text in the component.
If either of the arguments is out of bounds the selection should not be changed.
method.param: anchorIndex The zero-based index value of the character at the anchor end of the selection
activeIndex The zero-based index value of the character at the active end of the selection.

method.name: updateComposition
method.description:
Callback for updating the contents of the inline editing session.
This gets called whenever the text being edited with the IME has changed
and its contents are used by the client to redraw the entire inline edit session.
method.param: text contains the text of the inline edit session from the IME
attributes contains an array of composition clauses with adornment info
relativeSelectionStart start of the inline session relative to the start of the text object
relativeSelectionEnd end of the inline session relative to the start of the text object

method.name: compositionEndIndex
method.description:
The zero-based character index value of the end of the current edit session text (i.e.
all text in the inline session that is still not yet confirmed to the document).
method.return: the index of the last character of the composition, or -1 if there is no active composition.

method.name: compositionStartIndex
method.description:
The zero-based character index value of the start of the current edit session text (i.e.
all text in the inline session that is still not yet confirmed to the document).
method.return: the index of the first character of the composition, or -1 if there is no active composition.

method.name: selectionActiveIndex
method.description: The zero-based character index value of the last character in the current selection.
method.return: the index of the character at the active end of the selection, or -1 if no text is selected.

method.name: selectionAnchorIndex
method.description: The zero-based character index value of the first character in the current selection.
method.return: the index of the character at the anchor end of the selection, or -1 if no text is selected.

method.name: verticalTextLayout
method.description:
Indicates whether the text in the component is vertical or not. This will affect the positioning
of the candidate window (beside vertical text, below horizontal text).
method.return: true if the text is vertical, otherwise false.

classRec.name: ColumnState
classRec.description:
The ColumnState class calculates the sizes and locations of columns using
the width of the container and the container attributes. You can create instances of this class
independently to calculate column values, or you can get the column values that
were used for the text after the container has been composed or updated (redrawn).

method.name: ColumnState
method.description: Constructor function - creates a ColumnState object. If the values of controller.compositionWidth and controller.compositionHeight equal NaN (not a number), the constructor measures the container's contents to determine the actual composition width and height that feed into ColumnState. Use the constants defined by the flashx.textLayout.formats.BlockProgression class to specify the value of the blockProgression parameter. Use the constants defined by flashx.textLayout.formats.Direction to specify the value of the columnDirection parameter.
method.param:
blockProgression The direction of lines for the textflow, either BlockProgression.TB (top-to-bottom) or
BlockProgression.RL (right-to-left).

columnDirection The direction of column layout for the text flow, either Direction.RTL (right-to-left) or
Direction.LTR (left-to-right).
controller A ContainerController instance whose attributes are used to calculate the column values.
compositionWidth The horizontal extent, in pixels, allowed for text inside the container.
compositionHeight The vertical extent, in pixels, allowed for text inside the container.

method.name: computeColumns
method.description: Compute the actual columns based on the input values

method.name: getColumnAt
method.description:
Returns the area that a column takes within the container. Allows you to access the area for a
specific column.
method.param:
index The relative position of the column among all columns in the container, with the first
column at position 0.
method.return: The area of the specified column.

method.name: updateInputs
method.description:
Recalculate actual column settings based on attributes and width
from the container. Call this after either the attributes or the
width has been changed to get the new values.
method.param: newBlockProgression block progression for the textflow
newColumnDirection column layout direction for the textflow
containerAttr Formatting attributes from the container
containerWidth Width of the container
method.return: Boolean true if the actual column settings have changed

method.name: columnCount
method.description: The number of columns in the container.

method.name: columnGap
method.description: The amount of space, in pixels, left between columns in the container.

method.name: columnWidth
method.description: The width of columns, in pixels, in the container.

classRec.name: ScrollPolicy
classRec.description: The ScrollPolicy class is an enumeration class that defines values for setting the horizontalScrollPolicy and verticalScrollPolicy properties of the ContainerController class, which defines a text flow container.

field.name: AUTO
field.description: Specifies that scrolling is to occur if the content exceeds the container's dimension. The runtime calculates the number of lines that overflow the container and the user can navigate to them with cursor keys, by drag selecting, or by rotating the mouse wheel. You can also cause scrolling to occur by setting the corresponding position value, either ContainerController.horizontalScrollPosition or ContainerController.verticalScrollPosition. Also, the runtime can automatically scroll the contents of the container during editing.

field.name: OFF
field.description: Causes the runtime to not display overflow lines, which means that the user cannot navigate to them. In this case, setting the corresponding ContainerController.horizontalScrollPosition and ContainerController.verticalScrollPosition properties have no effect.

field.name: ON
field.description: Specifies that scrolling is available to access content that exceeds the container's dimension. The runtime calculates the number of lines that overflow the container and allows the user to scroll them into view with the cursor keys, by drag selecting, or by rotating the mouse wheel. You can also scroll by setting the corresponding position value, either ContainerController.horizontalScrollPosition or ContainerController.verticalScrollPosition. Also, the runtime can automatically scroll the contents of the container during editing.

field.name: scrollPolicyPropertyDefinition
field.description: Shared definition of the scrollPolicy property.

interfaceRec.name: ISandboxSupport
interfaceRec.description:
Interface to support TLF content in a sub-application. When an application is loaded in an untrusted context,
mouse events that occur outside of the untrusted application's bounds are not delivered. Clients can handle this
by implementing ISandboxSupport.

method.name: beginMouseCapture
method.description: Called to request clients to begin the forwarding of mouseup and mousemove events from outside a security sandbox.

method.name: endMouseCapture
method.description: Called to inform clients that the the forwarding of mouseup and mousemove events from outside a security sandbox is no longer needed.

method.name: mouseMoveSomewhere
method.description: Client call to forward a mouseMove event from outside a security sandbox. Coordinates of the mouse move are not needed.

method.name: mouseUpSomewhere
method.description: Client call to forward a mouseUp event from outside a security sandbox. Coordinates of the mouse up are not needed.

classRec.name: ContainerController
classRec.description: The ContainerController class defines the relationship between a TextFlow object and a container. A TextFlow may have one or more rectangular areas that can hold text; the text is said to be flowing through the containers. Each container is a Sprite that is the parent DisplayObject for the TextLines. Each container has a ContainerController that manages the container; the controller holds the target width and height for the text area, populates the container with TextLines, and handles scrolling. A controller also has a format associated with it that allows some formatting attributes to be applied to the text in the container. This allows, for instance, a TextFlow to have one container where the text appears in a single column, and a second container in the same TextFlow with two column text. Not all formatting attributes that can be applied to the container will affect the text; only the ones that affect container-level layout. The diagram below illustrates the relationship between the TextFlow, its flowComposer, and the display list.

method.name: ContainerController
method.description: Constructor - creates a ContainerController instance. The ContainerController has a default compositionWidth and compositionHeight so that some text appears in the container if you don't specify its width height.
method.param: container The DisplayObjectContainer in which to manage the text lines.
compositionWidth The initial width for composing text in the container.
compositionHeight The initial height for composing text in the container.

method.name: activateHandler
method.description: Processes the Event.ACTIVATE event when the client manages events.
method.param: event The Event object.

method.name: addBackgroundShape
method.description: Adds a flash.display.Shape object on which background shapes (such as background color) are drawn. The default implementation of this method, which may be overriden, adds the object to container just before the first flash.text.engine.TextLine child, if one exists, and after the last exisiting child otherwise.
method.param: shape flash.display.Shape object to add

method.name: addFloatAt
method.description: Add new float info (called by composition when a float is composed into the container

method.name: addInlineGraphicElement
method.description: Adds a flash.display.DisplayObject object as a descendant of parent. The default implementation of this method, which may be overriden, adds the object as a direct child of parent at the specified index. This is called to add InlineGraphicElements to the TextLine or container.
method.param: parent the flash.display.DisplayObjectContainer object to add the inlineGraphicElement to
inlineGraphicElement the flash.display.DisplayObject object to add
index insertion index of the float in its parent

method.name: addSelectionChild
method.description: Add a selection child.

method.name: addSelectionContainer
method.description: Adds a flash.display.DisplayObjectContainer object to which selection shapes (such as block selection highlight, cursor etc.) are added. The default implementation of this method, which may be overriden, has the following behavior: The object is added just before first flash.text.engine.TextLine child of container if one exists and the object is opaque and has normal blend mode. In all other cases, it is added as the last child of container.
method.param: selectionContainer flash.display.DisplayObjectContainer object to add

method.name: addSelectionShapes
method.description: Add selection shapes to the displaylist.

method.name: addTextLine
method.description: Adds a flash.text.engine.TextLine object as a descendant of container. The default implementation of this method, which may be overriden, adds the object as a direct child of container at the specified index.
method.param: textLine the flash.text.engine.TextLine object to add
index insertion index of the text line in its parent

method.name: attachTransparentBackgroundForHit
method.description:
No mouse clicks or moves will be generated for the container unless it has a background covering its area. Text Layout Framework
wants those events so that clicking on a container will select the text in it. This code
adds or updates (on size change) that background for Sprite containers only. This may cause clients problems
- definitely no hits is a problem - add this code to explore the issues - expect feedback.
We may have to make this configurable.

method.name: autoScrollIfNecessaryInternal
method.description: Handle a scroll event during a "drag" selection.
method.param: mouseX The horizontal position of the mouse cursor on the stage.
mouseY The vertical position of the mouse cursor on the stage.
method.returns: positive number if scroll went forward in reading order, negative number if it went backwards, and 0 if no scroll

method.name: autoScrollIfNecessary
method.description: Handle a scroll event during a "drag" selection.
method.param: mouseX The horizontal position of the mouse cursor on the stage.
