method.public: It's _preserveSelectionOnSetText to decide whether or not TLF preserve selection state during setText(). The default value is false, which means setText() does not preserve original selection state, setText() acts as what it was. If _preserveSelectionOnSetText is true, the original selection state is preserved during setText().

method.name: swfContext
method.description: Optional ISWFContext instance used to make FTE calls as needed in the proper swf context.

method.name: verticalScrollPolicy
method.description: Controls whether the factory generates all text lines or stops when the container bounds are filled.

field.name: _defaultConfiguration
field.description: Configuration to be used by the TextContainerManager. This can only be set once and before the inputmanager is used.

field.name: editingModePropertyDefinition
field.description: Shared definition of the scrollPolicy property.

classRec.name: TruncationOptions
classRec.description:
The TruncationOptions class specifies options for limiting the number of lines of text
created by a text line factory and for indicating when lines have been left out.

method.name: TruncationOptions
method.description: Creates a TruncationOptions object.
method.param:
truncationIndicator the string used to indicate that text has been truncated.
It appears at the end of the composed text. The default value is the horizontal ellipsis (U+2026).
lineCountLimit specifies a truncation criterion in the form of the maximum number of lines allowed. The default value of NO_LINE_COUNT_LIMIT indicates that there is no line count limit.

truncationIndicatorFormat specifies the format for the truncation indicator. A null format (the default value) specifies that the truncation indicator assume the format of content just before the truncation point. The TextLineFactory methods that take a simple string as input also ignore this parameter and implement the default behavior.

method.name: lineCountLimit
method.description: The maximum number of lines to create.
method.return: the line count limit

method.name: truncationIndicatorFormat
method.description: The style applied to the truncation indicator string.
method.return: the format truncation indicator

method.name: truncationIndicator
method.description:
A string used to indicate that content could not be fully displayed
because of limits on the number of lines.
method.return: the truncation indicator

method.name: lineCountLimit
method.description: Sets the maximum number of lines to create
method.param: val specifies the maximum number of lines allowed. A value of NO_LINE_COUNT_LIMIT indicates that there is no line count limit.

method.name: truncationIndicatorFormat
method.description: Sets the styles applied to the truncation indicator character
method.param: val specifies the format for the truncation indicator. A null format specifies that the truncation indicator assume the format of content just before the truncation point. The TextLineFactory methods that take a simple string as input also ignore this parameter and implement the default behavior

method.name: truncationIndicator
method.description: Sets the truncation indicator
method.param: val the string used to indicate that text has been truncated

field.name: HORIZONTAL_ELLIPSIS
field.description: Defines the truncationIndicator property value, \u2026, that represents a horizontal ellipsis.

field.name: NO_LINE_COUNT_LIMIT
field.description: Defines the lineCountLimit property value, -1, that represents no limit.

classRec.name: TextLineFactoryBase
classRec.description:
The TextLineFactoryBase class serves as the base class for the Text Layout Framework text line factories.

Note: Application code does not typically need to create or use a TextLineFactoryBase object directly. Use one of the derived text factory classes instead.

method.name: TextLineFactoryBase
method.description:
Base-class constructor for text line factories.

Note: Application code does not typically need to create or use a TextLineFactoryBase object directly. Use one of the derived text factory classes instead.

method.name: callbackWithTextLines
method.description:
Sends the created TextLine objects to the client using the supplied callback function.

This method sets the x and y properties of the line.
method.param: callback the callback function supplied by the factory user
delx the horizontal offset
dely the vertical offset

method.name: doesComposedTextFit
method.description: Indicates whether the composed text fits in the line count limit and includes all text

method.name: getContentBounds
method.description:
The smallest rectangle in which the layed-out content fits.

Note: Truncated lines are not included in the size calculation.

method.name: getNextTruncationPosition
method.description: Gets the next truncation position by shedding an atom's worth of characters.
method.param: truncateAtCharPosition the current truncation candidate position.
multiPara true if text has more than one paragraph.

method.name: compositionBounds
method.description: The rectangle within which text lines are created.

method.name: horizontalScrollPolicy
method.description:
Specifies how lines are created when the composition bounds are not large enough.

If set to ScrollPolicy.ON or ScrollPolicy.AUTO, all lines are created. It is the your responsibility to scroll lines in the viewable area (and to mask lines outside this area, if necessary). If set to ScrollPolicy.OFF, then only lines that fit within the composition bounds are created.

If the truncationOptions property is set, the scroll policy is ignored (and treated as ScrollPolicy.OFF).

method.name: isTruncated
method.description: Indicates whether text was truncated when lines were last created.

method.name: swfContext
method.description:
The ISWFContext instance used to make FTE calls as needed.

By default, the ISWFContext implementation is this FlowComposerBase object. Applications can provide a custom implementation to use fonts embedded in a different SWF file or to cache and reuse text lines.

method.name: truncationOptions
method.description: Specifies the options for truncating the text if it doesn't fit in the composition bounds.

method.name: verticalScrollPolicy
method.description:
Specifies how lines are created when the composition bounds are not large enough.

If set to ScrollPolicy.ON or ScrollPolicy.AUTO, all lines are created. It is the your responsibility to scroll lines in the viewable area (and to mask lines outside this area, if necessary). If set to ScrollPolicy.OFF, then only lines that fit within the composition bounds are created.

If the truncationOptions property is set, the scroll policy is ignored (and treated as ScrollPolicy.OFF).

field.name: _compositionBounds
field.description: Requested logical bounds to wrap to

field.name: _contentBounds
field.description: Bounds of composition results - where the text landed

classRec.name: TextFlowTextLineFactory
classRec.description:
The TextFlowTextLineFactory class provides a simple way to create TextLines for displaying text from a text flow.

The text lines are static and created fit in a single bounding rectangle, but can have multiple paragraphs and formats as well as inline graphics. To create TextLine objects directly from a string, use StringTextLineFactory.

Note: When using inline graphics, the source property of the InlineGraphicElement object must either be an instance of a DisplayObject or a Class object representing an embedded asset. URLRequest objects cannot be used. The width and height of the inline graphic at the time the line is created is used to compose the flow.

method.name: TextFlowTextLineFactory
method.description: Creates a TextFlowTextLineFactory object.

method.name: createTextLines
method.description:
Creates TextLine objects from the specified text flow.

The text lines are composed to fit the bounds assigned to the compositionBounds property. As each line is created, the factory calls the function specified in the callback parameter. This function is passed the TextLine object and is responsible for displaying the line. If a line has a background color, the factory also calls the callback function with a Shape object containing a rectangle of the background color.

Note that the scroll policies of the factory will control how many lines are generated.
method.param:
callback function to call with each generated TextLine object.
The callback will be called with a Shape object representing any background color (if present),
and with TextLine objects for the text.
textFlow The TextFlow from which the lines are created.

classRec.name: StringTextLineFactory
classRec.description:
The StringTextLineFactory class provides a simple way to create TextLines from a string.

The text lines are static and are created using a single format and a single paragraph. The lines are created to fit in the specified bounding rectangle.

The StringTextLineFactory provides an efficient way to create TextLines, since it reuses single TextFlow, ParagraphElement, SpanElement, and ContainerController objects across many repeated invocations. You can create a single factory, and use it again and again. You can also reuse all the parts that are the same each time you call it; for instance, you can reuse the various formats and the bounds.

Note: To create static lines that use multiple formats or paragraphs, or that include inline graphics, use a TextFlowTextLineFactory and a TextFlow object.

Note: The StringTextLineFactory ignores the truncationIndicatorFormat property set in the truncationOptions when truncating text.

method.name: StringTextLineFactory
method.description: Creates a StringTextLineFactory object.
method.param:
configuration The configuration object used to set the properties of the
internal TextFlow object used to compose lines produced by this factory.

method.name: createTextLinesInternal
method.description: Internal version preserves generated lines

method.name: createTextLines
method.description:
Creates TextLine objects using the text currently assigned to this factory object.

The text lines are created using the currently assigned text and formats and are composed to fit the bounds assigned to the compositionBounds property. As each line is created, the factory calls the function specified in the callback parameter. This function is passed the TextLine object and is responsible for displaying the line.

To create a different set of lines, change any properties desired and call createTextLines() again.

Note that the scroll policies of the factory will control how many lines are generated.
method.param: callback The callback function called for each TextLine object created.

method.name: getTruncationPosition
method.description:
Gets the truncation position on a line given the allowed width
- Must be at an atom boundary
- Must scan the line for atoms in logical order, not physical position order
For example, given bi-di text ABCD
atoms must be scanned in this order
A, B,
, C, D

method.name: measureTruncationIndicator
method.description:
Measures the truncation indicator using the same bounds and formats, but without truncation options
Resultant lines are added to _measurementLines

method.name: configuration
method.description: The configuration used by the internal TextFlow object.

method.name: defaultConfiguration
method.description: The default configuration used by this factory if none is specified.

method.name: paragraphFormat
method.description: The paragraph format.

method.name: spanFormat
method.description: The character format.

method.name: textFlowFormat
method.description: The text flow format.

method.name: text
method.description:
The text to convert into TextLine objects.

To produce TextLines, call createTextLines() after setting this text property and the desired formats.

classRec.name: ConversionType
classRec.description: Values for the format of exported text. The values STRING_TYPE and XML_TYPE can be used for the conversionType parameter for the export() method in the ITextExporter interface and the TextConverter class.

field.name: STRING_TYPE
field.description: Export as type String.

field.name: XML_TYPE
field.description: Export as type XML.

classRec.name: FormatDescriptor
classRec.description: Contains information about a format.

method.name: FormatDescriptor
method.description: Constructor.

method.name: clipboardFormat
method.description:
Descriptor used when matching this format to the formats posted on the external clipboard. If the format supports importing,
(it's importerClass is not null), it will be called when pasting from the clipboard, if the clipboard contents include data
in this format. If the format supports exporting, it will be called when copying to the clipboard, and the output it creates
will be posted to the clipboard with this clipboardFormat.

method.name: exporterClass
method.description: Returns the class used for converting to the format.

method.name: format
method.description: Returns the data format used by the converter.

method.name: importerClass
method.description: Returns the class used for converting data from the format.

interfaceRec.name: ITextExporter
interfaceRec.description:
Interface for exporting text content from a TextFlow instance to a given format,
which may for example be String or XML format, or a user-defined format. Exporters support the getting
and setting of properties to control the export of data. These properties are implemented
as public properties, but the direct access of these properties should be avoided, since
a user might replace the converter class in the TextConverter registry, causing a downcast
to fail.

method.name: export
method.description:
Export text content from a TextFlow instance in String, or XML, or a user defined format.

Set the conversionType parameter to either of the following values, or a user defined format in user-defined exporters.

  • flashx.textLayout.conversion.ConversionType.STRING_TYPE;
  • flashx.textLayout.conversion.ConversionType.XML_TYPE.
method.param: source The TextFlow to export
conversionType Return a String (STRING_TYPE) or XML (XML_TYPE), or any user defined format.
method.return: Object The exported content

method.name: errors
method.description: This property contains a vector of error messages as strings after a call to an exporter method is the throwOnError property is set to false, which is the default. If there were no errors, the property returns null. The property is reset on each method call.

method.name: throwOnError
method.description: The throwOnError property controls how the exporter handles errors. If set to true, methods throw an Error instance on errors. If set to false, which is the default, errors are collected into a vector of strings and stored in the errors property, and the exporter does not throw.

method.name: useClipboardAnnotations
method.description: The useClipboardAnnotations property controls whether or not the importer should handle the extra information necessary for the clipboard. When data is in a TextFlow, paragraphs are always complete, and include a terminator character. When a range of text is pasted to the clipboard, it will form paragraphs, but the range may not include in the final terminator. In this case, the paragraph needs to be marked as a partial paragraph if it is intended for the clipboard, so that if it is later pasted it will merge into the new text correctly. If the content is intended for the clipboard, useClipboardAnnotations will be true.

interfaceRec.name: ITextImporter
interfaceRec.description:
Interface for importing text content into a TextFlow from an external source.
The TextConverter class creates importers with no constructor arguments.

method.name: importToFlow
method.description: Import text content from an external source and convert it into a TextFlow.
method.param: source The data to convert.
method.return: TextFlow Created from the source.

method.name: configuration
method.description: The configuration property contains the IConfiguration instance that the importer needs when creating new TextFlow instances. This property is initially set to null.

method.name: errors
method.description: This property contains a vector of error messages as strings after a call to an importer method is the throwOnError property is set to false, which is the default. If there were no errors, the property returns null. The property is reset on each method call.

method.name: throwOnError
method.description: The throwOnError property controls how the importer handles errors. If set to true, methods throw an Error instance on errors. If set to false, which is the default, errors are collected into a vector of strings and stored in the errors property, and the importer does not throw.

method.name: useClipboardAnnotations
method.description: Controls whether or not the importer should handle the extra information necessary for the clipboard. When data comes in from the clipboard, it might contain partial paragraphs; paragraphs that are missing the terminator or newline character. If useClipboardAnnotations is true, the importer marks these partial paragraphs with a ConverterBase.MERGE_TO_NEXT_ON_PASTE attribute. This causes the paste operation to correctly handle merging of the pasted paragraph (and any list or div elements that may include the paragraph) into the text.

classRec.name: TextConverter
classRec.description:
This is the gateway class for handling import and export. It serves as a unified access point to the conversion functionality in the Text Layout Framework. It contains a registry for predefined as well as user defined input and/or output converters, plus a set of conversion methods.

The format of the converted data is not predefined; user written converters are free to accept and return any format of their choice. Common formats are strings, XML, and ByteArray instances. Converter authors should document which formats are supported.

method.name: addFormatAt
method.description:
Register a new format for import/export, at the specified location.
Location can be significant for clients that have multiple
choices for which format to use, such as when importing from the external clipboard.
Lower numbers indicate higher priority; these converters will be tried first.
The new format may support importing and/or exporting.
If the format has already been added, then it will be present in multiple locations. The
first one found will be used.
method.param: importClass The import converter class to register or null
exportClass The export converter class to register or null
format The format string tagging the converter classes
clipboardFormat The string used as the clipboard format when converting to/from the clipboard. Make this null if the format doesn't support clipboard access.

method.name: addFormat
method.description:
Register a new format for import/export. The new format will be added at the end,
as the lowest priority. Location can be significant for clients that have multiple
choices for which format to use, such as when importing from the external clipboard.
The new format may support importing and/or exporting.
If the format has already been added, then it will be present in multiple locations. The
first one found will be used.
method.param: importClass The import converter class to register or null
exportClass The export converter class to register or null
format The format string tagging the converter classes. Formats can be any name, but must be unique.
clipboardFormat The string used as the clipboard format when converting to/from the clipboard. Make this null if the format doesn't support clipboard access.

method.name: export
method.description:
Exports a TextFlow to a specified format.

Use one of the static constants supplied with this class, a MIME type, or a user defined format for user defined exporters to specify the format parameter:

  • TextConverter.TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT

Specify the type of the exported data in the conversionType parameter with one of the static constants supplied by the ConversionType class, or a user defined data type for user defined exporters:

  • ConversionType.STRING_TYPE
  • ConversionType.XML_TYPE

Returns a representation of the TextFlow in the specified format, or null on errors.
method.param: source Source content
format Output format
conversionType Type of exported data
method.return: Object Exported form of the TextFlow, or null on errors

method.name: getExporter
method.description:
Creates and returns an export converter, which you can then use to export from a TextFlow to a source string or XML object. Use this function if you have many separate exports to perform. It is equivalent to calling flashx.textLayout.conversion.TextConverter.export().

Use one of the static constants supplied with this class to specify the format parameter:

  • TextConverter.TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT

If the format has been added multiple times, the first one found will be used.
method.param: format Target format for exported data
method.return: ITextExporter Text exporter that can export in the specified format

method.name: getFormatAt
method.description: Returns the format name for the index'th format.

method.name: getFormatDescriptorAt
method.description: Returns the FormatDescriptor for the index'th format.

method.name: getImporter
method.description:
Creates and returns an import converter, which you can then use to import from a source string, an XML object, or any user defined data formats to a TextFlow. Use this method if you have many separate imports to perform, or if you want to handle errors during import. It is equivalent to calling flashx.textLayout.conversion.TextConverter.importToFlow().

Use one of the static constants supplied with this class to specify the format parameter, a MIME type, or a user defined data format.

  • TextConverter.TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT

If the format has been added multiple times, the first one found will be used.
method.param:
format Format of source content. Use constants from
flashx.textLayout.conversion.TextConverter.TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT, PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT, TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT etc,
a MIME type, or a user defined format.
config configuration to use during this import. null means take the current default. You can also set the configuration via the ITextImporter.configuration property.
method.return: ITextImporter Text importer that can import the source data

method.name: importToFlow
method.description:
Creates a TextFlow from source content in a specified format.

Use one of the static constants supplied with this class, a MIME type, to specify the format parameter, or use a user defined value for user-registered importers:

  • TextConverter.TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT
  • TextConverter.TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT
method.param: source Source content
format Format of source content
config IConfiguration to use when creating new TextFlows
method.return: TextFlow that was created from the source, or null on errors.

method.name: removeFormatAt
method.description: Remove the format at the index location.
method.param: index The format to remove

method.name: removeFormat
method.description:
Remove the format.
If a format was added multiple times, only the first one found is removed.
method.param: format The converter format string to remove

method.name: numFormats
method.description: Number of formats.

field.name: PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT
field.description:
Plain text format.
Use this for creating a TextFlow from a simple, unformatted String,
or for creating a simple, unformatted String from a TextFlow.

field.name: TEXT_FIELD_HTML_FORMAT
field.description:
HTML format. Use this for importing from, or exporting to, a TextFlow using the HTML fomat. The Text Layout Framework HTML supports a subset of the tags and attributes supported by the TextField class in the flash.text package.

The following table lists the HTML tags and attributes supported for the import and export process (tags and attributes supported by TextField, but not supported by the Text Layout Framework are specifically described as not supported):

Tag Description
Anchor tag The <a> tag creates a hypertext link and supports the following attributes:
  • target: Specifies the name of the target window where you load the page. Options include _self, _blank, _parent, and _top. The _self option specifies the current frame in the current window, _blank specifies a new window, _parent specifies the parent of the current frame, and _top specifies the top-level frame in the current window.
  • href: Specifies a URL. The URL can be either absolute or relative to the location of the SWF file that is loading the page. An example of an absolute reference to a URL is http://www.adobe.com; an example of a relative reference is /index.html. Absolute URLs must be prefixed with http://; otherwise, Flash treats them as relative URLs. Note: Unlike the TextField class, ActionScript link events are not supported. Neither are a:link, a:hover, and a:active styles.
Bold tag The <b> tag renders text as bold. A bold typeface must be available for the font used.
Break tag The <br> tag creates a line break in the text.
Font tag The <font> tag specifies a font or list of fonts to display the text.The font tag supports the following attributes:
  • color: Only hexadecimal color (#FFFFFF) values are supported.
  • face: Specifies the name of the font to use. As shown in the following example, you can specify a list of comma-delimited font names, in which case Flash Player selects the first available font. If the specified font is not installed on the local computer system or isn't embedded in the SWF file, Flash Player selects a substitute font.
  • size: Specifies the size of the font. You can use absolute pixel sizes, such as 16 or 18 or relative point sizes, such as +2 or -4.
  • letterspacing: Specifies the tracking (manual kerning) in pixels to be applied to the right of each character.
  • kerning: Specifies whether kerning is enabled or disabled. A non-zero value enables kerning, while zero disables it.
Image tag The <img> tag lets you embed external image files (JPEG, GIF, PNG), SWF files, and movie clips inside text.

The <img> tag supports the following attributes:

  • src: Specifies the URL to an image or SWF file, or the linkage identifier for a movie clip symbol in the library. This attribute is required; all other attributes are optional. External files (JPEG, GIF, PNG, and SWF files) do not show until they are downloaded completely.
  • width: The width of the image, SWF file, or movie clip being inserted, in pixels.
  • height: The height of the image, SWF file, or movie clip being inserted, in pixels.

Note: Unlike the TextField class, the following attributes are not supported: align, hspace, vspace, id, and checkPolicyFile.
Italic tag The <i> tag displays the tagged text in italics. An italic typeface must be available for the font used.
List item tag Note: Unlike the TextField class, the List item tag is not supported.
Paragraph tag The <p> tag creates a new paragraph. The <p> tag supports the following attributes:
  • align: Specifies alignment of text within the paragraph; valid values are left, right, justify, and center.
  • class: Specifies a class name that can be used for styling
Span tag The <span> tag supports the following attributes:
  • class: Specifies a class name that can be used for styling. While span tags are often used to set a style defined in a style sheet, TLFTextField instances do not support style sheets. The span tag is available for TLFTextField instances to refer to a class with style properties.
  • You can also put properties directly in the span tag: <span fontFamily="Arial">Hi there</span>. However, nested span tags are not supported.
Text format tag

The <textformat> tag lets you use a subset of paragraph formatting properties of the TextFormat class within text fields, including line leading, indentation, margins, and tab stops. You can combine <textformat> tags with the built-in HTML tags.

The <textformat> tag has the following attributes:

  • indent: Specifies the indentation from the left margin to the first character in the paragraph; corresponds to TextFormat.indent. Both positive and negative numbers are acceptable.
  • blockindent: Specifies the indentation applied to all lines of the paragraph.
  • leftmargin: Specifies the left margin of the paragraph, in points; corresponds to TextFormat.leftMargin.
  • rightmargin: Specifies the right margin of the paragraph, in points; corresponds to TextFormat.rightMargin.
  • leading: Specifies the leading (line height) measured in pixels between a line's ascent and the previous line's descent
  • tabstops: Specifies a comma-separated list of tab stop positions for the paragraph.
Underline tag The <u> tag underlines the tagged text.

When an unknown tag is imported the textFieldHTMLFormat importer will either set a single FlowElement's typeName property to that tag name or create a DivElement or a SubParagraphGroupElement with its typeName property set to the tag name.

The textFieldHTMLFormat exporter will export typeName as the XML tag when it is different from the default.

field.name: TEXT_LAYOUT_FORMAT
field.description:
TextLayout Format. Use this for importing from, or exporting to, a TextFlow using the TextLayout markup format. Text Layout format will detect the following errors:
  • Unexpected namespace
  • Unknown element
  • Unknown attribute

classRec.name: ConverterBase
classRec.description:
This is a base class for importers as well as exporters. It implements the error handling
plus property getters and setters that generate an error when invoked.

method.name: reportError
method.param: error the String that describes the error

method.name: errors
method.description:
Errors encountered while parsing.
Value is a vector of Strings.

field.name: MERGE_TO_NEXT_ON_PASTE
field.description: A converter that converts clipboard data into a TextFlow should use the MERGE_TO_NEXT_ON_PASTE property to control how the elements are treated when they are merged into an existing TextFlow on paste. This is useful if you want special handling for the case where only part of the element is copied. For instance, wheh a list is copied, if only part of the list is copied, and you paste it into another list, it merges into the list as additional items. If the entire list is copied, it appears as a nested list. When TLF creates a TextFlow for use on the clipboard, it decorates any partial elements with user properties that control whether the end of the element should be merged with the one after it. This user property is never pasted into the final TextFlow, but it may go on the elements in the TextScrap.textFlow. When copying text, the converter has the option to look for these properties to propagate them into the format that is posted on the clipboard. For instance, the plain text exporter checks the "mergeToNextOnPaste" property on paragraphs and supresses the paragraph terminator if it is found set to true. Likewise on import if the incoming String has no terminator, and useClipboardAnnotations is true, then it calls setStyle(MERGE_TO_NEXT_ON_PASTE, "true") on the corresponding paragraph so that when it is pasted it will blend into the paragraph where its pasted. This property should only be set on elements in a TextScrap, and only on the last element in the scrap.

interfaceRec.name: IPlainTextExporter
interfaceRec.description:
This interface should be implemented by converters that export plain text. Clients that have explicitly
created an exporter using TextConverter.getExporter may control the export process by calling into these methods on the
exporter.

method.name: paragraphSeparator
method.description:
Specifies the character sequence used (in a text flow's plain-text equivalent) to separate paragraphs. The paragraph separator is not added after the last paragraph.

This property applies to the PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT exporter.

The default value is "\n".

method.name: stripDiscretionaryHyphens
method.description:
This property indicates whether discretionary hyphens in the text should be stripped during the export process. Discretionary hyphens, also known as "soft hyphens", indicate where to break a word in case the word must be split between two lines. The Unicode character for discretionary hyphens is \u00AD.

If this property is set to true, discretionary hyphens that are in the original text will not be in the exported text, even if they are part of the original text. If false, discretionary hyphens will be in the exported text.

interfaceRec.name: IHTMLImporter
interfaceRec.description:
This interface should be implemented by converters that import HTML or HTML-structured data. Clients that have explicitly
created an importer using TextConverter.getImporter may control the import process by calling into these methods on the
importer.

method.name: imageSourceResolveFunction
method.description:
This property allows specification of a function to modify the source property supplied to an <img> element. Sample use would be to modify relative paths to some caller specified root path. The function takes the string set in the markup and returns the actual string to be used.

Note that by default relative paths are relative to the loaded SWF. One use of this function is to make relative paths relative to some other location.

The resolver function should look like this:

function resolver(src:String):String

It takes as an input parameter the value of src on the incoming img element, and returns the adjusted value.

method.name: preserveBodyElement
method.description:
This property tells the importer to create an element for the BODY tag in HTML markup.

The element will normally be a DivElement with typeName set to BODY.

This will also trigger parsing of class and id on the element.

method.name: preserveHTMLElement
method.description:
This property tells the importer to create an element for the HTML tag in HTML markup.

The element will normally be the top-level TextFlow element with typeName set to HTML.

This will also trigger parsing of class and id on the element.

interfaceRec.name: ITextLayoutImporter
interfaceRec.description:
This interface should be implemented by converters that import TextLayout structured data. Clients that have explicitly
created an importer using TextConverter.getImporter may control the import process by calling into these methods on the
importer.

method.name: imageSourceResolveFunction
method.description:
This property allows specification of a function to modify the source property supplied to an <img> element. Sample use would be to modify relative paths to some caller specified root path. The function takes the string set in the markup and returns the actual string to be used.

Note that by default relative paths are relative to the loaded SWF. One use of this function is to make relative paths relative to some other location.

The resolver function should look like this:

function resolver(src:String):String

It takes as an input parameter the value of src on the incoming img element, and returns the adjusted value.

classRec.name: PlainTextExporter
classRec.description: Export converter for plain text format. This class provides an alternative to the TextConverter.export() static method for exporting plain text. The PlainTextExporter class's export() method results in the same output string as the TextConverter.export() static method if the two properties of the PlainTextExporter class, the PARAGRAPH_SEPARATOR_PROPERTY and the STRIP_DISCRETIONARY_HYPHENS_PROPERTY properties, contain their default values of "\n" and true, respectively.

method.name: PlainTextExporter
method.description: Constructor

method.name: exportToString
method.description: Export text content as a string
method.param: source the text to export
method.return: String the exported content

classRec.name: FlowOperation
classRec.description:
The FlowOperation class is the base class for all Text Layout Framework operations.

Operations are transformations of a text flow. An Operation class defines the logic for performing and undoing the transformation. Operations are executed by an edit manager. Most applications do not need to create or manage operations directly (unless implementing a custom edit manager).

When an operation is performed, the edit manager dispatches an Operation object within the FlowOperationEvent object. You can query this Operation object to decide whether or not to allow the operation, to decide whether to perform some other operation as well, or to update related user-interface elements.

method.name: FlowOperation
method.description: Creates the FlowOperation object.
method.param: textFlow The text flow to which this operation is applied.

method.name: canUndo
method.description: Test if this operation be placed on the undo stack.
method.return: true means to push the operation onto the undo stack. false means do not push this operation.

method.name: doOperation
method.description:
Executes the operation.

This method must be overridden in derived classes. The base class method does nothing. You should not call doOperation() directly. The edit manager calls the method when it executes the operation.
method.return: Boolean true, if the operation succeeded. Otherwise, false.

method.name: merge
method.param: operation The FlowOperation to merge against
method.return:
A FlowOperation representing the combined operation if
the merge was successful, null otherwise.

method.name: redo
method.description:
Re-executes the operation.

This method must be overridden in derived classes. The base class method does nothing. You should not call redo() directly. The edit manager calls the method when it re-executes the operation.
method.return:
The SelectionState object passed to the operation when it was performed. This
SelectionState object can be the current selection or a selection created specifically
for the operation.

method.name: undo
method.description:
Reverses the operation.

This method must be overridden in derived classes. The base class method does nothing. You should not call undo() directly. The edit manager calls the method when it reverses the operation.
method.return:
The SelectionState object passed to the operation when it was performed. This
SelectionState object can be the current selection or a selection created specifically
for the operation.

method.name: beginGeneration
method.description:
The text flow generation before the operation.

A generation of 0 indicates that the operation did not complete.

method.name: endGeneration
method.description:
The text flow generation after the operation.

A generation of 0 indicates that the operation did not complete.

method.name: textFlow
method.description: The TextFlow object to which this operation is applied.

field.name: userData
field.description: Arbitrary data associated with an element.

classRec.name: RedoOperation
classRec.description: The RedoOperation class encapsulates a redo operation.

method.name: RedoOperation
method.description: Creates a RedoOperation object.
method.param: operation The operation to redo.

method.name: operation
method.description: The operation to redo.

classRec.name: CompositeOperation
classRec.description:
The CompositeOperation class encapsulates a group of transformations managed as a unit.

The CompositeOperation class provides a grouping mechanism for combining multiple FlowOperations into a single atomic operation. Grouping operations allows them to be undone and redone as a unit. For example, several single character inserts followed by several backspaces can be undone together as if they were a single operation. Grouping also provides a mechanism for representing complex operations. For example, a replace operation that modifies more than one text ranges can be represented and managed as a single composite operation.

Note: It can be more efficient to merge individual atomic operations rather than to combine separate operations into a group. For example, several sequential character inserts can easily be represented as a single insert operation, and undoing or redoing that single operation is more efficient than undoing or redoing a group of insert operations.

method.name: CompositeOperation
method.description: Creates a CompositeOperation object.
method.param: operations The operations to group.

method.name: addOperation
method.description:
Adds an additional operation to the end of the list.

The new operation must operate on the same TextFlow object as the other operations in the list.

method.name: operations
method.description: An array containing the operations grouped by this composite operation.

classRec.name: UndoOperation
classRec.description: The UndoOperation class encapsulates an undo operation.

method.name: UndoOperation
method.description: Creates an UndoOperation object.
method.param: op The operation to undo.

method.name: operation
method.description: The operation to undo.

classRec.name: FlowTextOperation
classRec.description: The FlowTextOperation is the base class for operations that transform a range of text.

method.name: FlowTextOperation
method.description: Creates the FlowTextOperation object.
method.param: operationState Specifies the relevant selection. If relevant to the operation, the operationState describes the text range to which this operation applies. Otherwise, operationState is used to save the current selection state so that it can be restored when the operation is undone.

method.name: redo
method.description:
Re-executes the operation.

This method must be overridden in derived classes. The base class method does nothing. You should not call redo() directly. The edit manager calls the method when it re-executes the operation.
method.return:
The SelectionState object passed to the operation when it was performed. This
SelectionState object can be the current selection or a selection created specifically
for the operation.

method.name: absoluteEnd
method.description: The absolute end point of the range of text to which this operation is applied.

method.name: absoluteStart
method.description: The absolute start point of the range of text to which this operation is applied.

method.name: originalSelectionState
method.description: The selection state at the start of the operation.

classRec.name: ApplyTCYOperation
classRec.description: The ApplyTCYOperation class encapsulates a TCY transformation.

method.name: ApplyTCYOperation
method.description: Creates an ApplyTCYOperation object.
method.param: operationState Describes the range of text to which the operation is applied.
tcyValue Specifies whether to apply TCY (true), or remove TCY (false).

method.name: newTCYElement
method.description: The TCYElement that was created by doOperation.

method.name: tcyOn
method.description:
Indicates whether the operation applies or removes TCY formatting.

If true, then the operation transforms the range into a TCY element. If false, then the operation removes TCY formatting from the first TCY element in the range.

classRec.name: SplitElementOperation
classRec.description:
The SplitElementOperation class encapsulates a change that splits any FlowGroupElement into two elements.
This operation splits target at operationState.absoluteStart.

method.name: SplitElementOperation
method.description:
Creates a SplitElementOperation object. This operation deletes a block selection and then splits the target at absoluteStart. The block selection should not cause target to be deleted.
Target is a FlowGroupElement but may not be a LinkElement, TCYElement or SubParagraphGroupElement.
method.param:
operationState Describes the point at which to split the element.
If a range of text is specified, the contents of the range are deleted.

method.name: newElement
method.description: Returns the new element created by doOperation.

method.name: targetElement
method.description: Specifies the element this operation modifies.

classRec.name: CreateSubParagraphGroupOperation
classRec.description: The CreateSPGEOperation class encapsulates creating a SubPargraphGroupElement

method.name: CreateSubParagraphGroupOperation
method.description:
Constructor.
This operation creates a single SubParagraphGroupElement in the first paragraph of the selection range. That paragraph must have at least one character selected the paragraph terminator does not count towards that selection.
Specifying the spgeParent creates an SubParagraphGroupElement int he part of the selection range included by that spgeParent.
method.param: operationState selection over which to apply the operation.
spgeParent optional parent for the spge element. If not specified one is chosen based on the selection
spgeFormat optional format to set in the new spge element.

method.name: format
method.description: Format to be applied to the new SubParagraphGroupElement

method.name: newSubParagraphGroupElement
method.description: The new SubParagraphGroupElement.

method.name: parent
method.description: Specifies the element this operation modifies.

classRec.name: CutOperation
classRec.description:
The CutOperation class encapsulates a cut operation.

The specified range is removed from the text flow.

Note: The edit manager is responsible for copying the text scrap to the clipboard. Undoing a cut operation does not restore the original clipboard state.

method.name: CutOperation
method.description: Creates a CutOperation object.
method.param: operationState The range of text to be cut.
scrapToCut A copy of the deleted text.

method.name: scrapToCut
method.description: scrapToCut the original removed text

classRec.name: ApplyFormatOperation
classRec.description:
The ApplyFormatOperation class encapsulates a style change.

An ApplyFormatOperation applies the leaf format to the text in the specified range (no change is made if the specified range is a single point). It applies the paragraph format to any paragraphs at least partially within the range (or a single paragraph if the range is a single point). And it applies the container format to any containers at least partially within the range (or a single container if the range is a single point).

method.name: ApplyFormatOperation
method.description: Creates an ApplyFormatOperation object.
method.param: operationState Defines the text range to which the format is applied.
leafFormat The format to apply to LeafFlowElement objects in the selected range.
paragraphFormat The format to apply to ParagraphElement objects in the selected range.
containerFormat The format to apply to containers in the selected range.

method.name: containerFormat
method.description:
The format properties to apply to the containers in the range.

The formats of any containers at least partially within the range are updated. If the range of this operation is a point, then a single container is updated. If containerFormat is null, then no container formats are changed.

method.name: leafFormat
method.description:
The format properties to apply to the leaf elements in the range.

If the range of this operation is a point, or if leafFormat is null, then no leaf element formats are changed.

method.name: paragraphFormat
method.description:
The format properties to apply to the paragraphs in the range.

The formats of any paragraphs at least partially within the range are updated. If the range of this operation is a point, then a single paragraph is updated. If paragraphFormat is null, then no paragraph formats are changed.

classRec.name: ClearFormatOperation
classRec.description:
The ClearFormatOperation class encapsulates a way to undefine formats.

An UndefineFormatOperation undefines properties set in the leaf format to the text in the specified range (no change is made if the specified range is a single point). It undefines properties set in the paragraph format to any paragraphs at least partially within the range (or a single paragraph if the range is a single point). And it undefines properties set in the container format to any containers at least partially within the range (or a single container if the range is a single point).

method.name: ClearFormatOperation
method.description: Creates an ClearFormatOperation object.
method.param: operationState Defines the text range to which the format is applied.
leafFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to LeafFlowElement objects in the selected range.
paragraphFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ParagraphElement objects in the selected range.
containerFormat The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ContainerController objects in the selected range.

method.name: containerFormat
method.description:
The format properties to undefine on the containers in the range.

The formats of any containers at least partially within the range are updated. If the range of this operation is a point, then a single container is updated. If containerFormat is null, then no container formats are changed.

method.name: leafFormat
method.description:
The format properties to undefine on the leaf elements in the range.

If the range of this operation is a point, or if leafFormat is null, then no leaf element formats are changed.

method.name: paragraphFormat
method.description:
The format properties to undefine on the paragraphs in the range.

The formats of any paragraphs at least partially within the range are updated. If the range of this operation is a point, then a single paragraph is updated. If paragraphFormat is null, then no paragraph formats are changed.

classRec.name: InsertTextOperation
classRec.description: The InsertTextOperation class encapsulates a text insertion operation.

method.name: InsertTextOperation
method.description: Creates an InsertTextOperation object.
method.param: operationState Describes the insertion point or range of text.
text The string to insert.
deleteSelectionState Describes the range of text to delete before doing insertion, if different than the range described by operationState.

method.name: redo
method.description:
Re-executes the operation after it has been undone.

This function is called by the edit manager, when necessary.

method.name: characterFormat
method.description: The character format applied to the inserted text.

method.name: deleteSelectionState
method.description:
The text deleted by this operation, if any.

null if no text is deleted.

method.name: text
method.description: The text inserted by this operation.

classRec.name: InsertInlineGraphicOperation
classRec.description:
The InsertInlineGraphicOperation class encapsulates the insertion of an inline
graphic into a text flow.

method.name: InsertInlineGraphicOperation
method.description: Creates an InsertInlineGraphicsOperation object.
method.param:
operationState Describes the insertion point.
If a range is selected, the operation deletes the contents of that range.
source The graphic source (uri string, URLRequest, DisplayObject, or Class of an embedded asset).
width The width to assign (number of pixels, percent, or the string 'auto')
height The height to assign (number of pixels, percent, or the string 'auto')
options The float to assign (String value, none for inline with text, left/right/start/end for float)

method.name: redo
method.description:
Re-executes the operation after it has been undone.

This function is called by the edit manager, when necessary.

method.name: newInlineGraphicElement
method.description: The InlineGraphicElement that was created by doOperation.

classRec.name: PasteOperation
classRec.description:
The PasteOperation class encapsulates a paste operation.

The specified range is replaced by the new content.

Note: The edit manager is responsible for copying the contents of the clipboard.

method.name: PasteOperation
method.description: Creates a PasteOperation object.
method.param:
operationState Describes the insertion point or a range of text
to replace.
textScrap The content to paste into the text flow.

method.name: textScrap
method.description: textScrap the text being pasted

classRec.name: CopyOperation
classRec.description:
The CopyOperation class encapsulates a copy operation.

Note: The operation is responsible for copying the text scrap to the clipboard. Undonig a copy operation does not restore the original clipboard state.

method.name: CopyOperation
method.description: Creates a CopyOperation object.
method.param: operationState The range of text to be copied.

classRec.name: ApplyLinkOperation
classRec.description: The ApplyLinkOperation class encapsulates a link creation or modification operation.

method.name: ApplyLinkOperation
method.description: Creates an ApplyLinkOperation object.
method.param: operationState The text range to which the operation is applied.

href The URI to be associated with the link. If href is an empty string,
the URI of links in the selection are removed.
target The target of the link.

extendToLinkBoundary Whether to extend the selection to include the entire
text of any existing links overlapped by the selection, and then apply the change.

method.name: extendToLinkBoundary
method.description:
Whether to extend the selection to include the entire
text of any existing links overlapped by the selection, and then apply the change.

method.name: href
method.description:
The URI to be associated with the link. If href is an empty string,
the URI of links in the selection are removed.

method.name: newLinkElement
method.description: The LinkElement that was created by doOperation.

method.name: target
method.description: The target of the link.

classRec.name: DeleteTextOperation
classRec.description: The DeleteTextOperation class encapsulates the deletion of a range of text.

method.name: DeleteTextOperation
method.description: Creates a DeleteTextOperation operation.
method.param: operationState The original range of text.
deleteSelectionState The range of text to delete, if different from the range described by operationState. (Set to null to delete the range described by operationState.)
allowMerge Set to true if this operation can be merged with the next or previous operation.

method.name: allowMerge
method.description:
Indicates whether this operation can be merged with operations executed before or after it.

Some delete operations, for example, a sequence of backspace keystrokes, can be fruitfully merged into one operation so that undoing the operation reverses the entire sequence.

method.name: deleteSelectionState
method.description: deleteSelectionState The range of text to delete

classRec.name: CreateListOperation
classRec.description: The CreateListOperation class encapsulates creating list

method.name: CreateListOperation
method.description: Creates an CreateListOperation object.

method.name: listFormat
method.description: TextLayoutFormat to be applied to the new ListElement.

method.name: newListElement
method.description: The new ListElement.

method.name: parent
method.description: Specifies the element this operation adds a new ListElement to.

classRec.name: CreateDivOperation
classRec.description: The CreateDivOperation class encapsulates creating DivElement

method.name: CreateDivOperation
method.description: Creates an CreateDivOperation object.

method.name: format
method.description: TextLayoutFormat to be applied to the new DivElement.

method.name: newDivElement
method.description: The new DivElement.

method.name: parent

classRec.name: FlowElementOperation
classRec.description: The FlowElementOperation class is the base class for operations that transform a FlowElement.

method.name: FlowElementOperation
method.description: Creates a FlowElementOperation object.
method.param: operationState Specifies the TextFlow object this operation acts upon.
targetElement Specifies the element this operation modifies.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the targetElement.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the targetElement.

classRec.name: MoveChildrenOperation
classRec.description: The MoveChildrenOperation class allows moving a set of siblings out of its immediate parent chain, and the operation removes any empty ancestor chain left behind.

method.name: MoveChildrenOperation
method.description:
Creates a MoveChildrenOperation object.

This operation moves a consecutive number of children of source into the destination context. Also, if moving the children leaves the source element with no children, then source will be removed. The removal is done recursively such that if source's parent becomes empty from the removal of source, it too will be deleted, and on up the parent chain.
method.param: operationState Specifies the SelectionState of this operation
source Specifies the parent of the item(s) to move.
sourceIndex Specifies the index of the first item to move.
numChildren Specifies the number of children to move.
destination Specifies the new parent of the items.
destinationIndex Specifies the new child index of the first element.

method.name: destinationIndex
method.description: Specifies the new child index of the first element.

method.name: destination
method.description: Specifies the new parent of the items.

method.name: numChildren
method.description: Specifies the index of the first item to move.

method.name: sourceIndex
method.description: Specifies the number of children to move.

method.name: source
method.description: Specifies the parent of the item(s) to move.

classRec.name: ModifyInlineGraphicOperation
classRec.description: The InsertInlineGraphicOperation class encapsulates the modification of an existing inline graphic.

method.name: ModifyInlineGraphicOperation
method.description: Creates a ModifyInlineGraphicsOperation object.
method.param:
operationState Describes the insertion point.
If a range is selected, the operation deletes the contents of that range.
source The graphic source (uri string, URLRequest, DisplayObject, or Class of an embedded asset).
width The width to assign (number of pixels, percent, or the string 'auto')
height The height to assign (number of pixels, percent, or the string 'auto')
options None supported

method.name: options
method.description: options are not supported

classRec.name: SplitParagraphOperation
classRec.description:
The SplitParagraphOperation class encapsulates a change that splits a paragraph into two elements.

The operation creates a new paragraph containing the text from the specified position to the end of the paragraph. If a range of text is specified, the text in the range is deleted first.

method.name: SplitParagraphOperation
method.description: Creates a SplitParagraphOperation object.
method.param:
operationState Describes the point at which to split the paragraph.
If a range of text is specified, the contents of the range are deleted.

classRec.name: ApplyFormatToElementOperation
classRec.description:
The ApplyFormatToElementOperation class encapsulates a style change to an element.

This operation applies one or more formats to a flow element.

method.name: ApplyFormatToElementOperation
method.description: Creates an ApplyFormatToElementOperation object.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text flow containing the element to which this operation is applied.
targetElement specifies the element to which this operation is applied.
format The formats to apply in this operation.

method.name: format
method.description:
The character formats applied in this operation.

If null no character formats are changed.

classRec.name: ApplyElementStyleNameOperation
classRec.description: The ApplyElementStyleNameOperation class encapsulates a style name change.

method.name: ApplyElementStyleNameOperation
method.description:
Creates a ApplyElementStyleNameOperation object.

If the relativeStart and relativeEnd parameters are set, then the existing element is split into multiple elements, the selected portion using the new style name and the rest using the existing style name.
method.param: operationState Describes the current selection.
targetElement Specifies the element to change.
newStyleName The style name to assign.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the target element.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the target element.

method.name: newStyleName
method.description: The style name assigned by this operation.

classRec.name: ApplyElementUserStyleOperation
classRec.description: The ApplyElementUserStyleOperation class encapsulates a change in a style value of an element.

method.name: ApplyElementUserStyleOperation
method.description:
Creates a ApplyElementUserStyleOperation object.

If the relativeStart and relativeEnd parameters are set, then the existing element is split into multiple elements, the selected portion using the new style value and the rest using the existing style value.
method.param: operationState Describes the range of text to style.
targetElement Specifies the element to change.
styleName The name of the style to change.
value The new style value.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the target element.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the target element.

method.name: newValue
method.description: The new style value.

method.name: styleName
method.description: The name of the style changed.

classRec.name: ApplyElementIDOperation
classRec.description: The ChangeElementIDOperation class encapsulates an element ID change.

method.name: ApplyElementIDOperation
method.description:
Creates a ChangeElementIDOperation object.

If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set, then the existing element is split into two elements, one using the existing ID and the other using the new ID. If both parameters are set, then the existing element is split into three elements. The first and last elements of the set are both assigned the original ID.
method.param: operationState Specifies the selection state before the operation
targetElement Specifies the element to change
newID The ID to assign
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the target element.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the target element.

method.name: newID
method.description: The ID assigned by this operation.

classRec.name: ClearFormatOnElementOperation
classRec.description:
The ClearFormatOnElementOperation class encapsulates a style change to an element.

This operation undefines one or more formats to a flow element.

method.name: ClearFormatOnElementOperation
method.description: Creates an ClearFormatOnElementOperation object.
method.param: operationState Specifies the text flow containing the element to which this operation is applied.
targetElement specifies the element to which this operation is applied.
format The formats to apply in this operation.

method.name: format
method.description:
The character formats applied in this operation.

If null no character formats are changed.

classRec.name: ApplyElementTypeNameOperation
classRec.description: The ApplyElementTypeNameOperation class encapsulates a type name change.

method.name: ApplyElementTypeNameOperation
method.description:
Creates a ApplyElementTypeNameOperation object.

If the relativeStart and relativeEnd parameters are set, then the existing element is split into multiple elements, the selected portion using the new type name and the rest using the existing type name.
method.param: operationState Describes the current selection.
targetElement Specifies the element to change.
newTypeName The type name to assign.
relativeStart An offset from the beginning of the target element.
relativeEnd An offset from the end of the target element.

method.name: typeName
method.description: The type name assigned by this operation.

method.name: TextAccImpl
method.description: Constructor.
method.param:
textContainer The DisplayObject instance that this
TextAccImpl instance is making accessible.
textFlow The TextFlow that is hosting the textContainer.

method.name: eventHandler
method.description:
Handles COMPOSITION_COMPLETE and SELECTION_CHANGE events,
updates the MSAA model.

method.name: exportToString
method.description:
TODO HACK, remove and refactor.
This is copied from PlainTextExportFilter, which I would prefer to
access through TextConverter.export(textFlow,
TextConverter.PLAIN_TEXT_FORMAT);
But, PTEF is in importExport, which builds against text_model,
which is a circular dependency.
Also, it seems to be adding a trailing newline, which is bad for
accessibility unless it is really there.
Might want to export and strip out hyphens.
Move it to the model?

method.name: get_accName
method.description: Returns the name of the text.
method.param: childID uint.
method.return: Name of the text.

method.name: get_accRole
method.description: Returns the system role for the text.
method.param: childID uint.
method.return: Role associated with the text.

method.name: get_accState
method.description: Returns the state of the text.
method.param: childID uint.
method.return: Role associated with the text.

method.name: get_accValue
method.description: Returns the value of the text.
method.param: childID uint.
method.return: Name of the text.

method.name: searchText
method.description:
Enable search index for Ichabod
Returns the entire text of the TextFlow, or null if search index is not enabled

method.name: selectionActiveIndex
method.description:
The zero-based character index value of the first character in the current selection.
Components which wish to support inline IME or Accessibility should call into this method.
method.return: the index of the character at the anchor end of the selection, or -1 if no text is selected.

method.name: selectionAnchorIndex
method.description:
The zero-based character index value of the last character in the current selection.
Components which wish to support inline IME or Accessibility should call into this method.
method.return: the index of the character at the active end of the selection, or -1 if no text is selected.

field.name: ROLE_SYSTEM_STATICTEXT
field.description: Default role -- read-only, unselectable text.

field.name: ROLE_SYSTEM_TEXT
field.description: Editable OR read-only, selectable text.

field.name: STATE_SYSTEM_INVISIBLE
field.description: Inivisible text

field.name: STATE_SYSTEM_NORMAL
field.description: Default state

field.name: STATE_SYSTEM_READONLY
field.description: Read-only text

field.name: textContainer
field.description: A reference to the DisplayObject that is hosting accessible text.

field.name: textFlow
field.description: A reference to the TextFlow where our text originates.
